title: Mississippi Chicken Recipe
description: Mississippi chicken is easy to make with seasoned chicken breasts and pepperoncini peppers for deliciously tangy and juicy shredded chicken.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Meat and Poultry Chicken Mississippi Chicken 4.7 (76) 67 Reviews 6 Photos Mississippi chicken is simple to make with just four ingredients for juicy, tangy shredded chicken that's delicious in buns or served over mashed potatoes or rice. You can make this in a slow cooker if you prefer. By Allrecipes Editorial Team Updated on January 21, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts 1 (1 ounce) package dry ranch dressing mix (such as Hidden Valley Ranch) 1 cup sliced and drained pepperoncini peppers 1/4 cup pepper juice (from jar of pepperoncini peppers) 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, sliced 1/2 cup water Directions Gather ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Season chicken with ranch seasoning mix; place in bottom of a medium Dutch oven. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Add pepperoncini peppers and 1/4 cup reserved pepper juice; top with sliced butter and pour in 1/2 cup water. Cover with a tight fitting lid, and bake in preheated oven until chicken is fork tender, 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Let stand 5 minutes. Shred chicken using two forks. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Serve and enjoy! Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Slow Cooker Version: Season chicken with ranch seasoning mix and place in the bottom of 6-qt. slow cooker. Add pepperoncini peppers and 1/4 cup reserved pepper juice; top with butter and pour in 1/2 cup of water. Cover, and cook until chicken is fork-tender on LOW for 6 hours or on HIGH for 4 hours. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Let stand 5 minutes. Shred chicken using two forks. I Made It Print 89 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 503 Calories 20g Fat 6g Carbs 72g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 503 % Daily Value * Total Fat 20g 25% Saturated Fat 9g 47% Cholesterol 224mg 75% Sodium 1126mg 49% Total Carbohydrate 6g 2% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 2g Protein 72g 144% Vitamin C 23mg 26% Calcium 71mg 5% Iron 3mg 15% Potassium 728mg 15% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Mississippi Chicken 01 of 06 Photo by  Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco 02 of 06 Photo by  SweetScone4549 03/10/2024 Family favorite It’s so easy and wonderful to eat as chicken tocos or layered over mashed potatoes or rice 03 of 06 Photo by  Kathie H 07/16/2023 Fabulous! Perfectly seasoned, not too spicy, juicy tender and full of flavor. I served it with green beans sautéed with garlic. Easy to make you! If you want it spicier, you can probably add some cherry peppers to the existing recipe. So good! 04 of 06 Photo by  QuirkyTray7665 04/04/2023 So simple and the spice was wonderful!!! My lips are still burning a little 😆I served it over egg noodles and had rawCarrots & celery as a side. Excited to have a way to use up the jar of peppers from Italian beef sandwich recipe. Delicious!!! 05 of 06 Photo by  Marianne 12/29/2022 Since my hubby loves peperoncinis, I decided to make this easy dish. I served it with buttered calrose rice and he was a happy camper. Thanks for the idea of this recipe! 06 of 06 Photo by  Paula 12/16/2022 I cut the recipe in half and made it in my slow cooker. I served it on buns with provolone cheese. It’s a spicy sandwich which packs a little bit of heat. 1 You’ll Also Love Chicken Stuffed Peppers with Enchilada Sauce 53 Ratings Island Chicken with Fruit Salsa 39 Ratings Sheet Pan Parmesan Chicken and Veggies 136 Ratings Cashew Crusted Chicken 334 Ratings Makhani Chicken (Indian Butter Chicken) 185 Ratings Salsa Chicken 4,750 Ratings Broccoli Cheese-Stuffed Chicken 20 Ratings Chicken-Stuffed Baked Avocados 447 Ratings Lemon Chicken Tenders 356 Ratings Baked Chicken with Peaches 376 Ratings Chicken with Lemon-Caper Sauce 463 Ratings Simple Broiled Chicken Breasts 1 Rating Easy Chicken Breast Wrapped in Bacon 32 Ratings Spicy Oven-Fried Chicken with Cheese Grits and Chorizo Reduction 4 Ratings Cream Cheese Chicken Enchiladas 97 Ratings Creamy Chicken Cordon Bleu Casserole 250 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
